meanings.definition: Divide into small, distinct units or quantities.
meanings.sent1: She quantised the candies into equal portions for each child.
meanings.sent2: The teacher quantised the pencils into sets of five for the students.
meanings.sent3: The chef quantised the ingredients into precise measurements for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The artist quantised the colors into separate palettes for each painting.
meanings.sent5: He quantised the puzzle pieces into organized groups for easier assembly.

meanings.definition: Restrict a physical property to discrete values.
meanings.sent1: The scientist quantised the energy levels to specific values for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The device quantised the temperature readings to whole numbers for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The magician quantised the disappearing act to only three possible outcomes.
meanings.sent4: The coach quantised the players' speed to set limits for the race.
meanings.sent5: She quantised the music volume to distinct levels for the performance.

meanings.definition: Measure or express in terms of quantities.
meanings.sent1: He quantised the distance in kilometers for better understanding.
meanings.sent2: The researcher quantised the data points to analyze the trends.
meanings.sent3: The baker quantised the recipe ingredients in cups and teaspoons.
meanings.sent4: The architect quantised the room dimensions in feet and inches.
meanings.sent5: She quantised the time intervals in minutes and seconds for the presentation.
